metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000494 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Uninitialized stack variable vulnerability in NameValueParserEndElt(upnpreplyparse.c) in miniupnpd < 2.0 allows an attacker to cause Denial ofService (Segmentation fault and Memory Corruption) or possibly haveunspecified other impact

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libminiupnpc8 - 1.6-3ubuntu2.14.04.4
miniupnpc - 1.6-3ubuntu2.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: miniupnpc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6-3ubuntu2.14.04.4').
miniupnpd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
